DOC.brief_summary: The primary objective study determine short-term outcome subject implant JOURNEY™ II BCS Total Knee System compare subject implant PS total knee system , determine difference health care resource consume may result economic saving patient , facility and/or payer . DOC.brief_title: Journey II BCS CMS Total Knee System Compared Other PS Total Knee Systems PT Setting
DOC.criteria: Undergone unilateral primary total knee replacement JOURNEY™ II BCS Total Knee System NonSmith & Nephew Posterior Stabilized Knee System Will initiate outpatient PT ≤ 7 day postoperatively Has primary diagnosis osteoarthritis , degenerative arthritis , traumatic arthritis Has preoperative ROM ≥ 90° Is skeletally mature PI judgment Is 21 year age older Is willing able participate require followup visit study site complete study procedure questionnaires Has consent participate study sign IRB/EC approve informed consent study Agrees follow post operative physical therapy program Significant preoperative varus valgus deformity ( > 15º ) Has receive constrain deep dish tibial insert Morbid obesity ( BMI > 40 ) Has obtain require prerehabilitation , preoperative intraoperative record week 2 visit Other comorbidities may impact outcomes osteoporosis , uncontrolled diabetes active infection Fibromyalgia require treatment Current impend incarceration prisoner In opinion PI emotional neurological condition would preempt ability willingness participate study include mental illness , mental retardation , drug alcohol abuse Is know risk lose followup , failure return schedule visit Undergone plan undergo total knee replacement contralateral knee within 6 month total knee replacement Requires Legally Authorized Representative consent study
